title: Quadrupia: A comprehensive catalog of G-quadruplexes across genomes from the tree of life
description: Quadrupia provides a large-scale catalog of G-quadruplexes (G4) across more than 100,000 genomes spanning the tree of life. G4s are non-canonical DNA structures formed by guanine tetrads and play roles in gene regulation and genome stability. This resource allows comparative and evolutionary analyses of G4 distribution across species.
keypoints: Systematic mapping of G4 sequences across species
Useful for studying DNA stability and transcriptional regulation

title: Microsatellites Explorer: A database of short tandem repeats across genomes
description: Microsatellites Explorer compiles short tandem repeats (STRs, microsatellites) from more than 117,000 genomes. STRs are repetitive DNA elements that are important markers for population genetics, forensics, and evolutionary biology. The platform provides a searchable interface and supports statistical and comparative analysis of STR distribution.
keypoints: Database of STRs from thousands of genomes
Supports research in diversity, forensics, and comparative genomics
est_entries: Millions of STR sequences (not explicitly specified)

title: kmerDB: A database encompassing genomic and proteomic k-mers
description: kmerDB is a database of genomic and proteomic k-mers, allowing researchers to analyze sub-sequences of DNA and proteins. K-mers are fundamental to bioinformatics, used in sequence alignment, genome assembly, motif discovery, and evolutionary analysis. This resource enables large-scale querying and cross-species comparisons.
keypoints: Includes both DNA and peptide k-mers
Supports motif discovery and functional associations
Provides a unified k-mer search framework
est_entries: Billions of k-mer entries (not explicitly specified)

title: MPRAbase: A Massively Parallel Reporter Assay database
description: MPRAbase is a curated database of Massively Parallel Reporter Assay (MPRA) results. It consolidates experimental data on the activity of regulatory DNA elements across different cell types and species. This allows functional analysis of gene regulation and the impact of variants on enhancer and promoter activity.
keypoints: Provides downloadable datasets and query interface

title: invertiaDB: A database of inverted repeats across genomes
description: invertiaDB provides a comprehensive collection of inverted repeats (IRs) from over 118,000 genomes, totaling more than 30 million sequences. IRs can form hairpins and cruciform DNA structures, which affect genome stability, replication, and rearrangements. The database supports advanced filtering and large-scale downloads.
keypoints: Searchable by length, GC content, and spacer size
Correlation observed between IR density and bacterial growth temperature

title: Darling v2.0: Mining disease-related literature
description: Darling v2.0 is a web-based application that mines biomedical literature and databases to extract associations between genes, diseases, drugs, and proteins. It integrates multiple data sources and applies advanced text mining techniques to provide structured knowledge graphs for biomedical research.
keypoints: Useful for drug discovery and bioinformatics pipelines
est_entries: Tens to hundreds of thousands of associations (not explicitly specified)

title: metagRoot: A comprehensive database of protein families in plant root microbiomes
description: metagRoot compiles protein families from plant root microbiomes, enabling functional analysis of microbial communities associated with roots. It allows researchers to explore how different protein families contribute to nutrient cycling, symbiosis, and plant health, and to compare microbiomes across plant species and conditions.
keypoints: Catalog of protein families from metagenomic data
Links microbial proteins to ecological and functional roles
est_entries: Tens of thousands of protein families (not explicitly specified)
